selectors.name: Parish Filter
selectors.caption: Select a parish below to see case, death, and test counts for the parish selected.

widgets.text:
COVID-19 data are reported as timely, accurately, and completely as made available to us. Data are updated as we receive information that is more complete and may change over time as we learn more.

 

For a map of LDH Regions click here.

 

Other Coronavirus Resources:

- Office of the Governor 

- Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

- World Health Organization

- Louisiana Department of Health

 

Points on the map do not represent the actual location of cases or deaths.

 

Cases reported include positive COVID-19 tests results from both the LDH Office of Public Health Laboratory and commercial labs. The CDC no longer requires that positive test results be confirmed. Cases are assigned to parish based on the residence of the patient. Patients may be hospitalized or seek care outside their Parish of residence.

 

*A person is presumed recovered if 

1) it has been more than 14 days, since he/she tested positive and he/she is not currently in the hospital or deceased (when hospital status is known), or 
2) it has been more than 21 days, since he/she tested positive and he/she is not deceased (when hospital status is unknown).  

Presumed recovered counts will be updated weekly.

 

Deaths reported include a cumulative count of COVID-19 deaths. Cases are assigned to parish based on the residence of the patient.

Probable COVID deaths are deaths identified by coroners and/or physicians as COVID-19 deaths or as probable/suspected/possible COVID-19 deaths without a lab positive result. This number could change if pending test results turn out positive or negative. Probable death counts will be updated weekly.

 

Tests reported here include those completed by the LDH Office of Public Health Laboratory and those performed by commercial labs and reported to the state.

Tests are assigned to parish based on the residence of the individual being tested when possible. Some negative test results from commercial labs may not have been reported to the state. Some of the commercial test results reported to the state are from out of state.

 

Age information related to positive cases may lag behind the initial reporting of those cases. We are updating data as we receive it.

 

Data Sources: LDH ID Epi Program, LDH BHI

If you have technical questions about this dashboard email cphi1@la.gov. 

For all other questions please contact the Louisiana 211 Network by dialing 211.

 

Disclaimer: The data presented here include preliminary information that are subject to change at any time. 

This website and its contents herein, including all data, mapping, and analysis (“Website”), copyright 2020 Louisiana Department of Health, all rights reserved, is provided to the public strictly for educational and academic research purposes.  The Website relies upon publicly available data from multiple sources that do not always agree. The Louisiana Department of Health hereby disclaims any and all representations and warranties with respect to the Website, including accuracy, fitness for use, and merchantability.  Reliance on the Website for medical guidance or use of the Website in commerce is strictly prohibited.

widgets.text:
Click the arrows under the map to see other information and download data. Data updated: 6/6/2020 at noon

Click to expand the sidepanel on the left to filter data by individual parishes.
widgets.name: Rich Text (3)

widgets.text: Louisiana Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information
widgets.name: Rich Text (4)
Cases by Tract
widgets.description: Only cases of persons testing positive for COVID-19 with accurate and complete address information are matched to tracts and counted. The addresses provided to LDH may not represent the residence of the patient in question. It is possible that some patients have the address of their facility of treatment or some other, non-residential address listed. Tracts with an estimated 2018 population below 1,000 were not assigned cases to safeguard privacy. 29,817 of 39,916 cases could be matched to tracts.
